case_title: Messrs R.M. GULISTAN ENGINEERS AND CONSTRUCTORS (PVT.) LTD. vs The COMMISSIONER INLAND REVENUE (APPEALS-IV), KARACHI
appellant: Messrs R.M. Gulistan Engineers and Constructors (Pvt.) Ltd.

accussed_details.name: Messrs R.M. Gulistan Engineers and Constructors (Pvt.) Ltd.
allegation: Short payment of duty and taxes on import of Seamless Steel Pipes/Tubes
Wrong application of S.R.O. 575(I)/2006 at the time of clearance of goods

complaint_summary: The appellant was alleged to have evaded duty and taxes by misclassifying imported goods under incorrect HS codes and availing inadmissible benefits under S.R.O. 575(I)/2006.
investigation_summary: Two show cause notices were issued alleging short payment of Sales Tax and Federal Excise Duty due to misclassification of goods under HS Code 7303.0000 instead of HS Code 7304.3900. The notices were dated 28.03.2012 and 21.04.2012.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal annulled the impugned orders, declaring them inconsistent, unlawful, and unsustainable due to jurisdictional issues, defective show cause notices, and time-barred claims under Section 36(2) of the Sales Tax Act, 1990.
legal_arguments: Jurisdictional issues under Sales Tax Act, 1990 and Federal Excise Act, 2005
Defective and time-barred show cause notices
Misclassification of goods under HS codes does not constitute misdeclaration
key_issues: Jurisdictional conflict between Customs and Inland Revenue authorities
Time-barred claims under Section 36(2) of Sales Tax Act, 1990

legal_terms.Double Jeopardy: Prohibition of being tried or punished twice for the same offense.
legal_terms.Coram non judice: Proceedings conducted by a court without jurisdiction.

words_and_phrases.Misdeclaration: Incorrect declaration of material particulars knowingly or intentionally.
words_and_phrases.Time-barred: Claims or actions that are invalid due to expiration of the statutory limitation period.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved allegations of tax evasion through misclassification of imported goods. The Tribunal annulled the orders due to jurisdictional issues, defective show cause notices, and time-barred claims. The appellant successfully argued the doctrine of double jeopardy and the lack of legal mandate for Inland Revenue officers to adjudicate the matter.

facts.allegation: Short payment of duty and taxes on import of Seamless Steel Pipes/Tubes.

show_cause_notices.details: Wrong application of S.R.O. 575(I)/2006 at the time of clearance of goods.
Misclassification under H.S. Code 7303.0000 instead of H.S. Code 7304.3900.

legal_issues.jurisdiction: Concurrent jurisdiction between Customs and Inland Revenue departments leading to 'Double Jeopardy'.
legal_issues.show_cause_notices: Deficient, vague, and time-barred under Section 36(2) of the Sales Tax Act, 1990.
legal_issues.classification: Dispute over PCT Heading for Ductile Cast Iron Pipes under S.R.O. 575(I)/2006.

appellant.jurisdiction: Audit and contravention report initiated by Directorate of Post Clearance Audit Lahore were without jurisdiction.
appellant.show_cause_notices: Not issued within the prescribed limitation period and lacked proper legal provisions.
appellant.classification: Incorrect claim to PCT Heading does not amount to misdeclaration.

respondent.jurisdiction: Inland Revenue Officer has authority under relevant provisions of Sales Tax Act, 1990 and Federal Excise Act, 2005.
respondent.classification: Imported items do not fall under 'machinery and equipment'.

decision.summary: Show cause notices dated 28.03.2012 and 21.04.2012 declared invalid and time-barred. Proceedings based on these notices annulled.
legal_basis: Section 36(2) of the Sales Tax Act, 1990
Relevant case laws cited by appellant
